job_title: Nurse Educator in Tinley Park, IL
pros: Enjoyed working with people who operate with integrity and treat you like you matter. Good work-life balance.
cons: Can’t think of any cons…

job_title: Certified Nurse Assistant, CNA in Elmhurst, IL
pros: 4 years and counting. Very nice coworkers, clean building and very nice location Everyone seems happy and work and management is very understanding. We have adequate supplies to work with and park place is very COVID conscious.
cons: I do not have any cons at this time.

job_title: Talent Acquisition Specialist in Tinley Park, IL
pros: I felt very welcomed when I started at Providence Life Services. Since I started, I feel a lot more stable in my career then I ever have and it's because of the culture at PLS. Everyone is very nice and supportive, and everyone makes a difference for the people we serve. Together we make an impact in all of our communities and residents that we provide care for.
cons: Like anywhere else, you have to be adaptable to change.

job_title: Resident Aide in Homer Glen, IL
pros: Great place to work love it here
cons: to me it’s an great place to work

job_title: Community Manager in Crete, IL
pros:
Organization operates true the mission statement of, "answering the call to enhance the lives of those we serve in the name of Jesus Christ." 
Polices and procedures are implemented not just for regulatory necessity, but also for what benefits the clients we serve the best. 
There is a large, tenured, core group of employees who are dedicated to the mission and supportive of each other. Senior management is always available and accessible. 
Company has PTO and a wide range of other benefits and support for all.
cons: Being a non-profit can present challenges in a competitive environment. However; this can also be an advantage as well.

job_title: Director of Digital Marketing in Tinley Park, IL
pros: Working in the Corporate office at Providence has been a great experience for me. Everyone that I've met seems to really genuinely care about the work we're doing and why we're here. I've worked in "faith-based" organizations before, but Providence really takes their mission to heart.
cons: Covid has been very difficult on our industry. Although I feel like our company did everything it could to protect the employees and residents, there's no denying the fact that everyone had to pick up extra work and adapt to stressful conditions.

job_title: Scheduling Coordinator in Downers Grove, IL
pros: Lots of food for floor staff instead of paying better hourly wages
cons: Zero work life balance, poor management who corporate does not manage as long as budget is met. Over worked and emotionally exhausted floor staff unsafe patient ratios

job_title: Talent Acquisition in Orland Park, IL
pros: Great team, very laid back, nice people to work with good benefits
cons: The recruiters should be able to get out more and do work fairs interviews they should visit the nursing homes that they are recruiting for to get an idea of what it’s like in nursing home so when interviewing

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Tinley Park, IL
pros: Lots of work good places
cons: Not fair to workers st time

job_title: Activity Coordinator in Elmhurst, IL
pros: Positive environment to grow and advance
cons: Attendance policy was very strict

job_title: Concierge in Saint John, IN
pros: Friendly co-workers, clean environment, nice pay, helpful management
cons: I do not have any cons to report

job_title: Corporate Office in Tinley Park, IL
pros: This is a place that really cares about its employees, as well as the residents who live at Providence communities. It's easy to work somewhere when you believe in what they are doing. Everyone is helpful and friendly. There are a lot of women in leadership positions, and it seems like it's the kind of place where if you work hard, you can move up. I work in the corporate offices, and they have a cook who makes amazing lunches every day for a low price, which means I don't have to leave for a lunch break. I can't think of a better place to work.
cons: You don't start with a lot of time off (1 week), but you can earn more time the longer you work there.

review_title: Great place to work, pay is ridiculous
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Homer Glen, IL
pros: Very nice facility, residents are the highlight of your day.  Schedules for the most part are kept, and reasonable.
cons: Pay is ridiculous. I actually made more money from the unemployment benefits I was receiving before starting there.  I did the right thing and got a job... But eventually left for a different job because my children and I couldn't afford to survive on their pay.

job_title: Marketing Manager in Tinley Park, IL
pros: The people you work with have a passion for helping each other and helping our residents. You don't have to work here long to feel the culture of support and encouragement. We work hard at our respective functions, but we have fun together as well. Top level management is very approachable and willing to talk with you about any concerns or ideas you may have. I highly recommend for anyone looking for a great place to work to consider Providence Life Services!
cons: I really don't have any criticism. You will work hard, but that is to be expected in any great workplace.

job_title: Care Manager in Homer Glen, IL
pros: The managers are very fair and available.  They work around your schedule, and we rarely work understaffed.  My nursing supervisors are available when I need them.  The residents here are wonderful, and that is why I love my job.
cons: The corporate training that is mandated by the company does not offer enough time in the evenings for training.  I go to school all day and some evenings.

job_title: Content Specialist in Tinley Park, IL
pros: Not only do I work here at the Corporate offices, but I also visit all the communities regularly. We have a CEO who has created a professional, compassionate culture that trickles down to the entire organization. This is a fantastic place to work, and a place that you can believe in. I recommend it highly as a place of employment, but I also recommend its communities highly.
cons: It's fast-paced in Marketing. I enjoy that, but not everyone does.

job_title: C N A in Palos Heights, IL
pros: Nice hourly pay, generally only ten residents to a C.N.A
cons: Unprofessional staff, racism, dirty facility, neglect and verbal elder abuse

review_title: A company that really values their employees!
job_title: CNA in Homer Glen, IL
pros: The company is non-profit and the employees are really appreciated for their role.  Management runs the facility well and the facility is kept clean. Supplies are abundant so that you will never run short on what you need.  The company keeps their facilities well staffed to eliminate much of the potential stress.  Being able to choose your schedule and only work every other weekend is another benefit of working here.
cons: The pay is a little low for a CNA.

job_title: CNA in Elmhurst, IL
pros: Residents were really sweet. Most of co workers really help each other out.
cons: Management is absolutely HORRIBLE! It's pretty sad when the residents/patients can tell there's a problem with management. They overwork the CNAs and are never actually on the floor to see all the problems themselves.

review_title: Difficult and stressful place to work
job_title: Registered Nurse in Palos Heights, IL
pros: Only Pro I can see is OT after 8 hours.
cons: Patient-staff ratio is way too high. Patients can't receive the care they need due to this. Poor teamwork with co-workers. Management does not help. They do not  seem to care how stressed the staff working on the floor is. Very stressful for the floor nurses. We are on our fourth administrator in 3 years. New hires are gone after a couple of months because they are afraid to continue to work in such stressful conditions.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Homer Glen, IL
pros:
Great location to work at-super clean environment
Amazing staff to work with 
Always a fun time with the residents
Management has an open door policy and are all wonderful to work with
There is room for advancement if you are qualified
cons:
Low wages compared to other companies
Takes a long time to get a raise
The Christian faith is really pushed here especially at corporate

job_title: Concierge in Elmhurst, IL
pros: the every day workers at my facility are fantastic, facility us clean, residents and general public are really nice
cons: senior management is just in it to line their own pockets

job_title: CNA in Zeeland, MI
pros: Compensation was great - could never find anything to match it.
cons: Overworked, understaffed, favoritism, management didn't listen to complaints even when they had us fill out surveys.

job_title: Maintenance Assistant in Homer Glen, IL
pros: Short commute. Lovely residents. Dedicated employees.
cons: Low salary. No c.o.l. Multitasking is the norm. Little to zero opportunity to advance. Employees are not incl. in decisions.

job_title: Anonymous in Elmhurst, IL
pros: Coworkers are very nice, work very hard and care about the residents. Residents and families are wonderful. Facility is beautiful.
cons: Overworked, unappreciated, and understaffed. The problem starts with upper management in not understanding how to solve their issues and deciding to make things better.

review_title: This is an awesome place. They work hard to follow necessary rules. If needed, I would recommend my family members.
job_title: CNA in Tinley Park, IL
pros: They offer awesome training classes!!
cons: The incentives offered are not good for extra assignments.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Downers Grove, IL
pros: Good pay and benefits  8-hour shifts. Paid time of available.
cons: Heavy patient load, frequently understaffed. Lots of call-offs.

job_title: Billing Coordinator in Downers Grove, IL
pros: The employees and residence are nice. Great work and it keeps you busy!

review_title: If you don’t want raises work here!
